an5.38:1.1: “Mendicants, a faithful gentleman gets five benefits.
an5.38:1.3: The true persons in the world show sympathy first to the faithful, not so much to the unfaithful.
an5.38:1.4: They first approach the faithful, not so much the unfaithful.
an5.38:1.5: They first receive alms from the faithful, not so much the unfaithful.
an5.38:1.6: They first teach Dhamma to the faithful, not so much the unfaithful.
an5.38:1.7: When their body breaks up, after death, the faithful are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
an5.38:1.8: A faithful gentleman gets these five benefits.
an5.38:2.1: Suppose there was a great banyan tree at a level crossroads. It would become a refuge for birds from all around.
an5.38:2.2: In the same way, a faithful gentleman becomes a refuge for many people—monks, nuns, laywomen, and laymen.
an5.38:3.1: With its branches, leaves, and fruit,
an5.38:3.2: a great tree with its strong trunk,
an5.38:4.3: Those that need shade go in the shade,
an5.38:4.4: those that need fruit enjoy the fruit.
an5.38:6.1: Those free of greed, freed of hate,
an5.38:6.3: fields of merit for the world,
an5.38:7.4: the undefiled one is fully extinguished.”
